alert.note: Alert for Southeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, South Lincoln County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 02 at 4:43PM MST until January 03 at 12:00AM MST by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...SNOW CONTINUES IN THE MOUNTAINS WITH SNOW AND SOME FREEZING DRIZZLE OVER THE PLAINS AND URBAN CORRIDOR THIS EVENING... .Snow will increase in coverage this evening with some light freezing drizzle possible over the plains. Slick travel can be expected at times due to the snow and locally light ice accumulations for the evening commutes. Snow will taper off for the urban corridor and mountains by late evening, however will linger overnight across the northeast plains. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT MST TONIGHT... * WHAT...Snow ongoing. Additional snow accumulations up to three inches. * WHERE...Southern Lincoln County. * WHEN...Until Midnight MST tonight. * IMPACTS...Snow and ice covered roads will make travel hazardous. Plan on slippery road conditions.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for Colorado can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or by going to www.cotrip.org.

area.areaDesc: Southeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, South Lincoln County
